title: Assistant HR Manager / HR Manager
content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
About the Role  
With 6+yrs HR Generalist experience, you have built a solid foundation across the full spectrum of HR functions (e.g. talent development and management, recruitment, compensation & benefits, learning & development, Talent business partnering, and Talent admin & operations). You use this understanding to uphold the smooth running of the HR Team, and to develop into a trusted advisor to internal stakeholders as you guide them and recommend/implement solutions. You are also in the early stages of establishing yourself as a team leader of managing, mentoring and developing junior Talent Team members.
What You’ll Do 

Your focus as an Assistant Manager / Manager, Talent:

Support the HR Director in overseeing the smooth day-to-day running of the HR Team in compliance with audit requirements, and with special focus on Operations and Business Partnering.
Support Business Unit / Department Leads in their HR-related matters, as well as their recruitment efforts. Connect and communicate with Business Unit / Department Leads in sharing ideas, recommendations and initiatives.
Act as the key interface of the company with local HR-related suppliers (e.g. insurance broker, payroll vendor, etc).
Support the HR Director in analysis of local market trends and designing country specific talent solutions.
Support and locally implement talent policies, processes, plans, programs and tools from the Regional HR Team, in collaboration with the HR Director and CFO.
Act as second-in-command of the HR Team, stepping in on behalf of the HR Director when unavailable.


What You’ll Need  

The qualities that will make you succeed:

Empathetic, approachable and discreet. Holds himself/herself to high standards of work ethics and morals. Has a strong ability to build relationships with internal stakeholders.
Approaches situations in a humane way but at the same time, having an appreciation for the business’ needs, and balancing between these two perspectives.
Strong problem-solving skills; having the ability to think out-of-the-box to arrive at constructive solutions that do not break policy.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment with matrix-reporting structures, and with intelligent and creative personalities. Experience working in an international creative, PR or media agency would be advantageous.
Detail-oriented, organized, proactive, independent, with a willingness to be hands-on when needed.
Inspiring team leadership and mentorship abilities
Driven to create change and improvements.
Strong verbal and written English communication skills

Qualifications:

Typically 6+ years of Generalist HR experience, preferably with 1 year’s experience in supervising a small team.
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent.
Experience in International Creative, PR, Media Agency or International MNC would be highly preferred.
Strong knowledge of the Malaysia Employment Act and local employment practices
Good understanding of payroll administration, SOX compliance, expat relocation/management and expat benefits administration, and Covid19 regulations around talent and workplace matters.


How We’ll Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.  


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
